titleStmt.title: The vnbeliefe of St. Thomas the Apostle laid open for the comfort of all that desire to belieue. Whereunto is added a comfortable treatise for all that are afflicted in soule or body. The first armeth vs against despaire in the houre of death; the second against impatience vnder the crosse. By Nicholas Bound, Doctor in Diuinitie.
titleStmt.author: Bownd, Nicholas, d. 1613.

titleStmt.title: The vnbeliefe of St. Thomas the Apostle laid open for the comfort of all that desire to belieue. Whereunto is added a comfortable treatise for all that are afflicted in soule or body. The first armeth vs against despaire in the houre of death; the second against impatience vnder the crosse. By Nicholas Bound, Doctor in Diuinitie.
titleStmt.author: Bownd, Nicholas, d. 1613.
Bownd, Nicholas, d. 1613. Treatise ful of consolation. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by J. Legat] for Robert Allot at the blacke Beare in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Another issue, with cancel general title page, of Bownd, Nicholas. The unbeleefe of S. Thomas the apostle (STC 3441.5). In two parts. Includes Bownd, Nicholas. A Treatise ful of consolation.
Running title reads: The vnbeleefe of S. Thomas.
Imperfect; print show through. Lacks part 2.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
